info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 29 at 9:04PM CDT until March 30 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS Lake Charles LA
info.description:
NWS Employees, Emergency Management, and Public have reported water that had risen out small streams and drainage ditches toward both business and residential structures. Standing water and ponding will continue over the next several hours near and within the city of Rayne. Neighboring cities within western Lafayette and eastern Acadia Parishes will also continue to experience aerial flooding through the next several hours.
* WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Louisiana, including the following parishes, in south central Louisiana, Lafayette. In southwest Louisiana, Acadia.
* WHEN...Until 245 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 849 PM CDT, emergency management reported heavy rainfall has occurred in Rayne due to thunderstorms. Although rainfall has ceased, flooding is still ongoing. Between 6 and 10 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Crowley, Scott, Rayne, Duson, Mire, Lyons Point and Estherwood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM CDT SUNDAY
